titleStmt.title: The compassionate Samaritane unbinding the conscience, and powring oyle into the wounds which have beene made upon the separation: recommending their future welfare to the serious thoughts, and carefull endeavours of all who love the peace and unity of Commonwealths men, or desire the unanimous prosecution of the common enemie, or who follow our Saviours rule, to doe unto others, what they would have others doe unto them.
titleStmt.author: Walwyn, William, 1600-1681.

titleStmt.title: The compassionate Samaritane unbinding the conscience, and powring oyle into the wounds which have beene made upon the separation: recommending their future welfare to the serious thoughts, and carefull endeavours of all who love the peace and unity of Commonwealths men, or desire the unanimous prosecution of the common enemie, or who follow our Saviours rule, to doe unto others, what they would have others doe unto them.
titleStmt.author: Walwyn, William, 1600-1681.
Goodwin, John, 1594?-1665, attributed name.

editionStmt.edition: The second edition, corrected, and enlarged.

notesStmt.note: Anonymous. By William Walwyn. Sometimes also attributed to John Goodwin.
Annotation on Thomason copy: "Jan: 5th"; "London"; caret after 'and' in edition statement and "much" written above line.
Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
